summary: This document is an internal email chain and incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 23, 2019. It details the discovery of inmate Jeffrey Epstein in his cell with red marks on his neck, his claim that his cellmate attempted to kill him, his subsequent placement on suicide watch, and internal discussions about drafting a report for higher authorities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found in his cell with red marks on his neck, claiming his cellmate attempted to kill him. He was placed on suicide watch and medically assessed.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who initially responded to the call for assistance in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and found Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Physician Assistant
persons.context: Conducted a medical assessment of Jeffrey Epstein at 6:30 a.m., noting erythema on his neck and knee, and that Epstein was smiling and denied knowledge of the events.

persons.name: Psychologist

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York

connections.description: The Operations Lieutenant was the first responder who found Epstein in his cell and initiated the incident response.
The Physician Assistant medically assessed Epstein following the incident, documenting his physical condition and statements.
The Psychologist evaluated Epstein's mental state and made the determination to keep him on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injuries in Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit with red marks on his neck. He claimed his cellmate had attempted to kill him.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Following the discovery, Epstein was placed in hand restraints, escorted to a suicide cell, and placed on suicide watch for further observation.

events.title: Medical and Psychological Assessments
events.description: Epstein was medically assessed at 6:30 a.m. and psychologically evaluated at 9:10 a.m. The medical assessment noted erythema on his neck and knee, while the psychological assessment resulted in his continued suicide watch.

events.title: Internal Email Chain Regarding Incident Report
events.description: Internal emails between MCC staff discuss the confusing nature of an initial memo and request a drafted email detailing Epstein's actions, status, and plans to move him to a general population unit for forwarding to higher authorities (IPPA and the Director).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York 10007

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a circular line of erythema (redness) around his neck, which he could not explain.
Epstein claimed to staff that his cellmate had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, and that he had informed his attorney of this matter.
Despite the physical marks, medical staff noted Epstein was 'smiling during this clinical encounter' and denied any pain, discomfort, or knowledge of how the injuries occurred.
Following the incident, prison authorities were reviewing his case for placement in the general population (Unit 7 South) and seeking an appropriate cellmate.
Internal communications show confusion over the initial incident report and an effort to draft a clear summary for senior officials at the Bureau of Prisons (IPPA and the Director).
